qas.question: What do studies show has a bidirectional relationship with the circadian system?
What do abusive drugs effect in the circadian system?
What do drug abusers show in their circadian processes?
What can the disrupted circadian system cause?
What can disruption to genetics and environment in the sleep cycle cause?

plausible_answers.text: Studies conducted on both animals and humans

qas.question: What studies show a minor relationship between the circadian system and drug abuse?
What is displayed by individuals when not abusing drugs?

plausible_answers.text: the risk for substance abuse and relapse

qas.question: What may be increased by a person's normal sleep and wake cycle?

context: <b5_0>Studies conducted on both animals and humans<b5_0/> show major bidirectional relationships between the circadian system and <a0_0>abusive drugs<a0_0/>. It is indicated that these abusive drugs affect the central <a1_0>circadian pacemaker<a1_0/>. Individuals suffering from substance abuse display <a2_0><b6_0>disrupted rhythms<b6_0/><a2_0/>. These disrupted rhythms can increase <b7_0>the risk for substance <a3_0>abuse and relapse<b7_0/><a3_0/>. It is possible that genetic and/or environmental disturbances to the normal sleep and wake cycle can increase the <a4_0><b8_0>susceptibility to addiction<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
